Topic.Title: DONT just sit there and waych the pigz unload into a 30% DROP

Message.Msg: "why is today the start of the prolonged drop, instead of just another in the long line of headfaches? why does the govt shutdown/ debt ceiling matter, when the true event is the end of 85 billion a month injections, which is still at least 6 months away?" The markets have hit all time highz, mirroring 1974 peak b4 the '75 crash. Capitulation of demoralized shorts iz pervasive, they have duccumbed to the belief that the fed cant print forever and the markets will never stop rizing. They are quick to cover and slow to short, volumez are low following a seriez of high volume price spikes that indicate distribution and covering of shorts capitulating. The vix iz rising from low levelz and does not reflect the pervasive risk that can be found in debt, equity, and currency markets. Trust iz at an all time low. Sentiment and charts indicate a HUGE fall. We may bounce at 200 day averagez, but it will be short lived and an excellent shorting opportunity.

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Homeytheclown03, I was on this this board for few days and was baffled about that--there were no gross revenue for product sales. The only way that makes sense would be some kind of benefits toward service revenue, but I don't see that at all. This was going on from 2011 and forward. That's why you see declined in net income and entering in negative territory. There are room for improvements on financials. For starter, increase the margin of product sales. For example, for 2012 margin on product sales was about 13% if Amazon increased it to 30% (which I think is reasonable) and still have a reasonable market price for consumers, Amazon could improve operating income by about $8 and bottom line by $6B (after estimated 25% tax). Service revenue was enough to cover all expenses on P&L, except for COGS (including fulfillment). Earning per share would be $13 ($6B/456.9M outstanding shares) and P/E ratio would be about 23.5. Amazon can try to find alternative ways to reduce COGS and can still improve pricing (but the product margin need to be at a healthy level). I hope they price it right on new products to avoid above problem and improve bottom line signfiicantly. I was also baffle about this board. You would thought posters would be talking about product rumors and potential upcoming products and etc. There are rumors floating out there about set-top box, android console, smartphone (regular, 3D, and Kindle). The facts that Lab126 is expanding and recently leased more than 500,000 sq. ft. of space in Moffett Tower. Amazon recently filed trademark application for name "Firetube", possibly for a set-top box. Cheers!

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Dear dear sybil_rulez, You need to put on your glasses and relook at the Statement of Cash Flows from 10K. Let me help you, OK. ***CASH BASIS NOT ACCRUAL*** 2010, 2011, 2012 Years $3.5B, $3.9B, $4.2B Cash inflows from operating activities (Yes.. they generated incomes) ($979M), ($1,811M), ($3,785M) Capex (investing for future growth) ($352M), ($705M), ($745M) Acquisition (investing for future growth) ($2,029M), $586M, $935M (Purchase)/ sales of marketable securities and other investments ($3,360M), ($1,930M), ($3,595M) Cash flows from investing activities $143M, $177M, $3,378M Proceeds from LT debts (borrowed money for investing, not for operating acts) ($221M), ($444M), ($588M) Repayments of LT debts 0, ($277M), ($960M) Common stocks repurchased $259M, $62M, $429M Excess tax benefit from stock-based compensation $181M, ($482M), $2,259M Cash flows from financing activities $3,777M, $5,269M, $8,084M Cash and cash equivalent balance I am not going to spell it out to you. If you cannot do a simple analysis or even understand the implication of above numbers, then that is your loss. Good luck! Cheers! :o)
